sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Time.ElapsedCPU function is used on a multitasking system such as UNIX to determine the amount of time that has been used by this program (process). The number of central processor milliseconds assigned to this program is returned. This is of little use on a personal computer, where Time.ElapsedCPU returns the same value as Time.Elapsed.
sections.text_content: The Time.ElapsedCPU function is used on a multitasking system such as UNIX to determine the amount of time that has been used by this program (process). The number of central processor milliseconds assigned to this program is returned. This is of little use on a personal computer, where Time.ElapsedCPU returns the same value as Time.Elapsed.
sections.mdown_content: The **Time.ElapsedCPU** function is used on a multitasking system such as UNIX to determine the amount of time that has been used by this program (process). The number of central processor milliseconds assigned to this program is returned. This is of little use on a personal computer, where **Time.ElapsedCPU** returns the same value as **Time.Elapsed**.

sections.title: Example
code:
var timeUsed : int
        timeUsed := Time.ElapsedCPU
        put "This program has used ", timeUsed,
                " milliseconds of CPU time"
sections.raw_content: On a UNIX system, this program tells you how much time it has used.
sections.text_content: On a UNIX system, this program tells you how much time it has used.
sections.mdown_content: On a UNIX system, this program tells you how much time it has used.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Time.ElapsedCPU, not by calling ElapsedCPU.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling Time.ElapsedCPU, not by calling ElapsedCPU.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling **Time.ElapsedCPU**, not by calling **ElapsedCPU**.
